body:
Hi all, 

I'm trying to install `magics@4.1.0` and `netcdf` is not enabled but it's looking for `netcdf.h`, below is the error

```console
$ spack install magics@4.1.0

  >> 1721    /tmp/sw-spack/spack-stage/k202129/spack-stage-magics-4.1.0-ovn7fwy
             r5ttihvzhqwkimyz5ezhzgzaf/spack-src/src/decoders/NetcdfData.h:26:1
             0: fatal error: netcdf.h: No such file or directory
     1722     #include "netcdf.h"
     1723              ^~~~~~~~~~
     1724    compilation terminated.
  >> 1725    make[2]: *** [src/CMakeFiles/MagPlus.dir/decoders/TileDecoder.cc.o
             ] Error 1
     1726    make[2]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
     1727    make[2]: Leaving directory `/tmp/sw-spack/spack-stage/k202129/spac
             k-stage-magics-4.1.0-ovn7fwyr5ttihvzhqwkimyz5ezhzgzaf/spack-build'
  >> 1728    make[1]: *** [src/CMakeFiles/MagPlus.dir/all] Error 2
     1729    make[1]: Leaving directory `/tmp/sw-spack/spack-stage/k202129/spac
             k-stage-magics-4.1.0-ovn7fwyr5ttihvzhqwkimyz5ezhzgzaf/spack-build'
  >> 1730    make: *** [all] Error 2
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux btlogin1 2.6.32-754.23.1.el6.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Sep 17 09:46:55 EDT 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 6.10 (Santiago)
``` 
Any idea how to get around to it? I mainly need that to install `cdo` package.

Thanks
Amjad
